data.text: @USMortality @DarkShimShim Close to 1 million have died from COVID in the US.  How many died from vaccine?

@USMortality @DarkShimShim "how do you explain the ongoing excess mortality in the US?"

Not enough people have immunity yet (either via infection or vaccination).

@USMortality If I'm reading your chart correctly, it looks like case numbers dropped when the vaccine doses increases, only for the covid cases to spike around the time that Delta appeared and became the dominant strain. It shows how many vaccines doses were administered during that time.

@USMortality Is "excess mortality" not the number of deaths over and above the historical average? Looks like it's pretty in line with covid deaths. Your graph doesn't show any vaccine-related deaths.

@USMortality @kay_cee000 @science_lil Vaccine mandates have been around for hundreds of years. Christ. Washington forced his army to pour the puss from cowpox boils into open wounds to inoculate them against Smallpox (killing 2% of them in the process) 

This vaccine has s safety profile 200x better than aspirin
@nanimononaranu (Cont2...) I thought we could use 413 to calculate the rate but then I realized that it's the number of reported AEs and not the number of pregnant women who were vaccinated.

@nanimononaranu (Cont...) I don't think we can use any of these values to get the miscarriage rate because we need to know the total number to women who got vaccinated in the timeframe. Of course even that number would be wrong since not all pregnant women would report it.

@nanimononaranu Surprisingly, I think we're both wrong here. The 270 cases are all miscarriages. It's just that 238 didn't report a specific reason like the others. I think I understand this report better now. This isn't drug trial data, it's voluntary reports in a specific timeframe.

@thatisfalse1 @USMortality You can of course let the virus itself rage in your blood vessels if you're more comfortable with that.
Hint: People who let that happen died more often than vaccinated people.
